comment: Whisky on the Hudson 9/18/2014 : Need to retry.  Was decent, from what I recall.
Bought a liter from duty free on my way out of the country. Tasty bought another on the way back in.
Reminds me of Christmas fruitcake cherry licorice very fruity great with dessert

Defiantly loves water. Sweet and for desert. Nose: Christmas fruit cake. Dry cherries, licorice & apricot. 
Taste: cinnamon, marmalade 
Finish: spicy, warm

This offering reminds me of smells and taste of grandmothers fruitcake. 

Good for a cold day, great substitute for sherry by the fireplace.
I've tried this one both neat and with a drop of water. I prefer it neat. I noticed notes of raisins on the palate and chocolate on the finish. I was surprised by the lower score.

[Whiskey Live paris 2015] Very thick.  Definitely sherried.  Pretty harsh, light smoke.  Felt like I was gnoshing on raspberries and strawberries.  I was left feeling slightly underwhelmed, but It definitely has texture and punch to it.  I would recommend if you're a Glenlivet fan looking for something more interesting.
Vanilla, caramel and hint of orange peel on the nose. Notable heat.  The pallet gives way to an increase in sweetness with just a hint of cinnamon. Nice long finish.

Excellent dram. Compares nicely to Macallan Cask Strength which is one of my favorites. A spot of water definitely opens it up and brings out some of the alcohol notes along with the Sherry. Not for the faint of heart.
Sweet on the nose, with hints of maple and caramel.  Sherry and nutty notes on the tongue.  A thick, long finish that lingers beautifully

First of all, delicious. Huge nutty, sherry nose. Full bodied, rich mouthfeel, very luscious. Plenty of sherry flavors throughout from the lengthy time spent in those barrels, slightly sweet cherry balanced with the tannin from the wood.

Tasted at the Iberian Lounge, Hotel Hershey. Quite a liberal pour, easily 3x what it should have been! At cask-strength, it requires a lot of water to balance, but the nose was immense, with rich ambrosial raisin, milk chocolate, warm caramel, some caramelized onions and even earthy mushroom, on a background of freshly turned soil (not peat, but nitrogen). On the palate; thick, hint of soap initially, then sweet oak spices, recognizable signature marzipan and hint of zesty grapefruit rind. Long finish, malty, minty and fairly hot, just enough to remind you to pace yourself. I'm a bit ashamed to admit it, but I believe this NAS Sherry version impressed me almost as much as the original 16. Bravo! Dry glass: sweet, metallic and woody.

The nose is rich and smooth with the sherry note right there. To drink you get the oily texture of non-chill filtered varieties, followed by the brief burn of cask stregnth. Then the body hits smooth, creamy, spicy and just a little nutty. The texture stands out more than the flavour but there are pleanty of subtle notes to appreciate. I seem to pick out different flavours every time I try it so while it won't be my everyday choice I will probably keep a bottle around.
Rik och kraftig doft av choklad, kola, sirap. Vanilj från ekfat. Smaken i samma spår, vanilj kraftigast och därefter spår sv kolade fat.
Very smooth and a late bite. Lasting tingle on the tongue that is pleasant.

I opened this last night wit some family over for Memorial Day.  I believe it's a 16 yr old ( didn't specify here).   It's rich and semi-sweet...really a great after dinner drink.  Definately needs a cube of ice to bring out the hazelnut and nutty flavors.  Open it up, let it breathe a bit, and add either ice or water.  Does wonders then.   This was a hit for all around----very much the "Oban 14" type where all would love it.  Great to keep around when you have a range of folks coming and wanted something fairly liked by all
Strong alcohol smell, sweet cuz of the OLOROSO, bland finish

Hot, and jumbled.
Water adds butterscotch and evens it out.
Cask strength at 60.3%
Much too strong for me. This is the only scotch I have ever owned where I needed to add water to make it drinkable. Reminded me of drinking Hot 100 cinnamon schnapps back in high school (don't ask)

Having the 1st dram of this from my bottle and I must say this is amazing! 60.3% ABV, no alcohol burn at all. A mouth full of dark fruits, it reminds me of forest fruit jam, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries. Great sherry flavours with a nice spicy bite to it, I can keep sipping this all night. Cheers my fellow addicts!
Sweet. Vanilla. A little burn, even with a little water. Still very nice.

Great value again, only 83 Canadian $ and delicious. I'm talking about the cask strenght version, I have the 48% travel retail exclusive as well but I keep that one for guests :p. Very fruity on the nose, a big hit of plums and apricots. It has also a dry and slightly salty quality to it. Very long finish of dark fruits again, my tong is a bit numb because of the ABV. Great dessert dram!
Super boozy at 120 proof. With a little water it really opens up.
Rich Christmas cake/pudding, candied ginger, dry sherry, chocolate and spiciness from the cask. A fine dram.
had the cask strength version. loved the nose of chocolate right off the bat. got a little bit of the sherry notes on the taste
smell of dried fruits and the taste is subtle at first followed by orange.

The nose is almost overpowering sherry. 

Wow ! Strong.  Flavour come at the end

This stuff is very good, nice mouth feel, glenlivet reliable taste, cask strength flavor, great spice, low price- my only complaint is the nose- it was a little flat in comparison to the palate. I sampled this in a “flight” with a few different high end bourbons and scotches, and even my non whiskey obsessed friends were impressed. Good stuff. WAAAY better than and 81... I’d give it a 94

Shy short of getting a full 5 stars, this is fantastic stuff. Like truly fantastic. Nutmeg, sultana raisins and prunes, with dark chocolate on the finish. 

Love it!
Rich and spicey. A different offering from Glenlivet. Enjoy it a lot

Olfato: pêras cozidas (talvez maçãs vermelhas), ameixas secas, notas frutadas de frutos vermelhos além de bons aromas apimentados e doces. 

Paladar: basicamente as mesmas notas identificadas no olfato, porém entrega um dulçor além do esperado. Boas notas apimentadas e amadeiradas. As tradicionais características do vinho Jerez Oloroso estão presentes, tais como as de oxidação, frutos vermelhos e frutos secos.

Finalização: média para curta.

Impressões gerais: não trata-se de uma bomba de Jerez como inicialmente esperava-se, mas com certeza trata-se de um whisky saboroso. Possui um ABV elevado, o que pode assustar alguns degustadores desavisados, no entanto algumas gotas de água podem acalmar este whisky, auxiliando os paladares menos acostumados com graduações alcoólicas mais altas.
Quite a delicious whisky! Really sweet, lots of vanilla and a bit of bite to it that makes it a pleasant and enjoyable drop! Not much to linger on, but still delicious.
Mouth blast with alcohol. Add a little water for salty taste.
surprised by this one, mellow and full bodied warm and broad
strong alcohol bite with a fruity note on the nose and slightly bitter note to finish.
Dried fruits.  Stewed prunes. Baby powder.  Brown sugar. Whispers of beef broth. And...(I dont mean this in a bad way)...a hint of roach kill spray.
Fruit and brown sugar on the nose.  Rich buttery spice with a long finish.
Spicy, fruity and on the dryer side. Sherry is predominant but it is not very complex. A tasty dram nevertheless...

Nose : Simple nose, fruits, malt and a bit of vanilla.

Taste : Malt amd wood are predominant, covering much of the fruit.

Finish : Finish is again pretty malty, not really particular
Gentle, sweet, v fruity, slightly spicy. Lacks punch compared to the cask strength edition but is much easier to drink.

★★★★½
Avent 2019 - 20/24.
Nom de dieu que ce whisky est bon, pratiquement aussi bon que le film que je m'apprête à écouter, The Matrix. Je me sens projeter dans un autre univers et je ne suis pas capable de faire la différence entre le monde réel et le monde des rêves. Une propulsion de fruits mûre me jette littéralement sur le dos. C'est puissant, c'est corsé, c'est magnifique. J'adore!
Spicy and long finish. Sexy and risqué
Have yet to have a bad taste from this. Spicier and less peaty. Goes down smooth and warms you up.
Recall this being excellent, peaty, easy, smooth, fun sipping scotch. The scotch that got me into scotch
So far, favorite Glenlivet offered. Smooth sherry finish with notes of fruit and butter. Wow!!!
